channel.title: CVE Feed for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and ArubaOS 10
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and ArubaOS 10

item.title: CVE-2023-22780|2024-08-02T10:20:31.097Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20access%20points%20running%20instantos%20and%20arubaos%2010
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying services that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22787|2024-08-02T10:20:30.280Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20access%20points%20running%20instantos%20and%20arubaos%2010
item.description: An unauthenticated Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in a service accessed via the PAPI protocol provided by Aruba InstantOS and ArubaOS 10. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected access point.

item.title: CVE-2023-22781|2024-08-02T10:20:30.365Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20access%20points%20running%20instantos%20and%20arubaos%2010
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying services that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22789|2024-08-02T10:20:30.333Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20access%20points%20running%20instantos%20and%20arubaos%2010
item.description: Multiple authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the Aruba InstantOS and ArubaOS 10 command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22791|2024-08-02T10:20:30.672Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20access%20points%20running%20instantos%20and%20arubaos%2010
item.description: A vulnerability exists in Aruba InstantOS and ArubaOS 10 where an edge-case combination of network configuration, a specific WLAN environment and an attacker already possessing valid user credentials on that WLAN can lead to sensitive information being disclosed via the WLAN. The scenarios in which this disclosure of potentially sensitive information can occur are complex and depend on factors that are beyond the control of the attacker.
